author: m.kalinin

author: potuz
content:
We're seeing these messages, they are delivered by Nimbus but it could be anyone, in any case I think Nimbus should not be broadcasting these
```
time="2023-10-23 12:44:20" level=debug msg="Gossip message was ignored" agent=nimbus error="epoch 35 root 0x98cccf892929bcedb7f028d18a1945204de35589beb794249d8a6f064f395cd9: not a checkpoint in forkchoice" gossip score=1.9558940606976583 multiaddress="/ip4/157.230.177.155/tcp/48936" peer id=16Uiu2HAmRN9fxqjdyaX3XGw28fr5g2NSgHumL3jesuZNL7WkqcKc prefix=sync topic="/eth2/4c402a37/beacon_aggregate_and_proof/ssz_snappy"
```
Someone is attesting to a block in the middle of the epoch, with a parent in the middle of the epoch, and using that blockroot as a checkpoint

author: potuz
content: that cannot pass gossip validation

content: the peer belongs to nimbus-erigon-1

author: tersec
content: <@755590043632140352> is that check required? Not obvious to me from https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/v1.4.0-beta.3/specs/phase0/p2p-interface.md#beacon_aggregate_and_proof it is

author: tersec
content: https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/blob/8b07f4fd4c58ffd05f6c3b2753b24883b162a96d/beacon_chain/gossip_processing/gossip_validation.nim#L927-L933 treats it implicitly

author: tersec
content: But it doesn't check anything specific to checkpoints, only that basically the block it refers to exists

author: tersec
content: Seems okay by https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/v1.4.0-beta.3/specs/phase0/fork-choice.md#get_checkpoint_block

author: potuz
content: I think you' re right, we discussed this only internally when we added this check: this was the result of the spamming of bad attestations in mainnet a while ago, we realized that there were plenty that were being gossiped that are worthless for everyone. It's a simple and cheap check, perhaps it makes sense to add it for the target checkpoint

content: <@654267572107083777> regardless of the gossip rules, you may want to check since all the messages I can find are from Nimbus, whether you are attesting for an invalid checkpoint: there's no way any forkchoice can have those roots in an actual checkpoint, no matter how badly synced the node is

author: pk910
content:
This is the voting summary as of epoch 118:
```
Voting period: 1
Incumbent: block 0x68cf3d944f75dcf02a1ee31bc421063597634c4b5395ccb53fdab60a0cfacb44, deposit count 0
Slots through period: 1725 (3772)
Votes this period: 1544
  block 0xb7d0567b638d751aaf9f34eb0bb45b58e0f347a8c7c6a72c0db1a4ef2d948e55, deposit count 3156: 823 votes (47.71%)
  block 0x78c3334a1cb399f6f64c4bb391c0358957e50cccad8e9e7203f526c5502e68ce, deposit count 3169: 316 votes (18.32%)
  block 0x78c3334a1cb399f6f64c4bb391c0358957e50cccad8e9e7203f526c5502e68ce, deposit count 1714: 186 votes (10.78%)
  block 0x68cf3d944f75dcf02a1ee31bc421063597634c4b5395ccb53fdab60a0cfacb44, deposit count 0: 97 votes (5.62%)
  block 0x78c3334a1cb399f6f64c4bb391c0358957e50cccad8e9e7203f526c5502e68ce, deposit count 1715: 54 votes (3.13%)
```

it looks like prysm client pairs are consistently voting for the second opinion.
lodestar pairs vote for the 3rd & 5th opinion, which has a invalid deposit count inside

author: pk910
content:
I think opinion 2,3 & 5 are invalid.
block 0x78c3334a1cb399f6f64c4bb391c0358957e50cccad8e9e7203f526c5502e68ce is at block height  1711.  
Voting period 1 started at block height 1719, so prysm is voting for a block with a distance lower than the `ETH1_FOLLOW_DISTANCE` of 12.
